author: Special Correspondent
text:
The need for creating awareness among the workers involved in the construction activities for enrolling themselves as members of the Construction Workers Welfare Board to enable them to get various benefits was stressed at a meeting of the officials of the various government departments held in the city recently.

The meeting was organised by the Labour Welfare Department.

Marimuthu, Joint Commissioner of Labour, who presided over the meeting, explained the various benefits being extended to the construction workers who are members of the welfare board. The government provided assistance of Rs. 5 lakh to the workers who were killed in accidents at the workplace. The officials should take steps for enrolling all the construction workers in their respective areas as members of the board.

Radhakrishnan, Labour Officer – Social Security Scheme, spoke.

The officials from Salem Corporation, District Rural Development Agency, Tangedco, National Highways and State Highways, TWAD Board and municipal officials participated.
title: ‘Enrol construction workers in welfare board’
